channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Big pothole pavement side opposite island, 21st February
item.description:
There is a large pothole by the pavement of the Crayford bound side of the road here. It is opposite the crossing island limiting the avoiding that can be done. It has been there a couple of months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on right side of width restriction, 21st February
item.description:
This pothole had been here for at least a couple of months and I think it's gotten worse in the recent bad weather. It being in the width restriction (alongside the driver side pole when driving towards Thames Road) makes it impossible to avoid and it may start damaging cars.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road has dropped around a metal cover in the road, 21st February
item.description:
At the junction of Arnsberg Way/Mayplace Road West (closest to car park area to rear of shops) the brick road has subsided around a large metal road cover, this is now raised over 4cms above the bricks now. It is a trip hazard to pedestrians and for anyone riding a motorcycle or bicycle in particular. There are also several other dips in the road at this location. This is causing tyres to spin as vehicles turn as the road has dropped and tyres can't grip the road. This junction would benefit from some repairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Selby Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Litter on the pavement, 21st February
item.description:
This litter has in place for sometime and spreads when it is windy. I hope by reporting it, an effort will be made to clear it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Castlewood Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Old furniture and appliances dumped, 21st February
item.description:
Weeks later the issue of broken furniture and rubbish has not been attended to by the bins outside Laxfield Court. There is now an old refrigerator dumped in the entrance as well. Could the council please come and remove immediately.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pownall Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed outside Bedwell house residential flats. The graffiti is by two bin containers sprayed on a Lamberh storage container., 21st February
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed outside Bedwell house residential flats on Brixton main road SW9. The graffiti is by two Lambeth bin containers next to a Lambeth storage unit. The graffiti has been there approximately over a week. It looks like it can be wiped off with a cleaning solution. Please can it be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 336, Brixton Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30cm plus round pothole in road in Mayplace Road West, 21st February
item.description:
It is a very large and deep pothole just shy of the area where people cross the road at the junction with Arnsberg Way and Mayplace Road West. If a motorbike or bicycle rides across it there will likely be injury to the rider. It seems quite recent as there is a lot of debris on the pavement from it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Third world problems, 21st February
item.description:
This is Beckenham not a third world country, we pay ridiculous taxes. Keep it clean please. Spend more money on this instead of cultural crap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Groveland Road, Elmers End, Greater London

item.title: Litter and detritus, 21st February
item.description:
Gutters and pavement edges not been cleaned for weeks. Lots of build up of litter, cardboard, nappies etc Needs proper manual sweep on top of the cursory and ineffective road sweeping vehicle which often pushes litter to the edges
